nl.tudelft.jpacman.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.jpacman.game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Level.LevelObserver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SinglePlayerGame

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements Level.LevelObserver
    A basic implementation of a Pac-Man game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new game.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts or resumes the game.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Pauses the game.

      • isInProgress

        public boolean isInProgress()
        Returns:
        true iff the game is started and in progress.

      • getPlayers

        public abstract java.util.List<IdentifiedPlayer> getPlayers()
        Returns:
        An immutable list of the participants of this game.

      • getLevel

        public abstract AILevel getLevel()
        Returns:
        The level currently being played.

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int levelIndex)
        Sets the level to the one that has the given id (calls #Game.setLevel).
        Parameters:
        levelIndex - The id of the level we want to switch to

      • setLevel

        protected abstract void setLevel(AILevel level)
        Forces subclasses to provide a method to switch to the given Level.
        Parameters:
        level - The Level we want to switch to

      • continousMovement

        public void continousMovement(IdentifiedPlayer player,
                              Direction direction)
        Moves the specified player until the next cross in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to move.
        direction - The direction to move in.

      • move

        public void move(IdentifiedPlayer player,
                 Direction direction)
        Moves the specified player one square in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to move.
        direction - The direction to move in.

      • levelWon

        public void levelWon()
        Description copied from interface: Level.LevelObserver
        The level has been won. Typically the level should be stopped when this event is received.
        Specified by:
        levelWon in interface Level.LevelObserver

      • levelLost

        public void levelLost()
        Description copied from interface: Level.LevelObserver
        The level has been lost. Typically the level should be stopped when this event is received.
        Specified by:
        levelLost in interface Level.LevelObserver

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Forces subclasses to provide a method allowing to reset the score and the number of lives the player has. (should be called when a new level is set "manually")

      • makeLevel

        protected AILevel makeLevel(int id)
        Creates a new level. Uses the map parser to parse the desired board file.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the level we want to load.
        Returns:
        A new level.

      • nextLevel

        public AILevel nextLevel()
        Returns the next level and increments the currentLevel field. If this was already the last level, simply restart it.
        Returns:
        The new(and next) level.

      • getCurrentLevel

        protected int getCurrentLevel()
        Simple getter for currentLevel.
        Returns:
        The id of the current level.

      • setStrategy

        public void setStrategy(PacmanStrategy strategy)
        Set the strategy.
        Parameters:
        strategy - chosen by the player.
